intro: Marsdenia tolimensis, commonly known as the Tolima Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, and it is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
